intro: Axinaea carolina-telleziae, commonly known as the Colombian wax tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Colombia. This evergreen shrub or small tree is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical, leathery leaves that are arranged in whorls. The flowers are small, fragrant, and typically white or pale pink, clustered in cymes. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
